publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7753 Jackie Baillie: Lollipop Legend—That the Parliament congratulates Bryan Warren on winning Scotland’s Lollipop Person of the Year Award; understands that the children at Jamestown Primary School describe him as the "best lollipop man in the universe"; commends him for donating his prize money to the Vale Of Leven Remembrance Day Association, of which he is the chairman, and further congratulates him for his dedication and commitment to the safety of the children at Jamestown Primary School.
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-7753 Jackie Baillie: Lollipop Legend—That the Parliament congratulates Bryan Warren on winning Scotland’s Lollipop Person of the Year Award; understands that the children at Jamestown Primary School describe him as the "best lollipop man in the universe"; commends him for donating his prize money to the Vale Of Leven Remembrance Day Association, of which he is the chairman, and further congratulates him for his dedication and commitment to the safety of the children at Jamestown Primary School. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn

S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Des McNulty*, Ross Finnie*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Ian McKee*, David Whitton*, Stewart Maxwell*, Hugh Henry*, Pauline McNeill*, Jamie McGrigor*, Sarah Boyack*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Marilyn Livingstone*, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Mr Frank McAveety*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Kidd*, Patricia Ferguson*, Jim Tolson*, Helen Eadie*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Karen Whitefield*, Sandra White*
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Elaine Murray*
S3M-7753 Lollipop Legend (lodged on 19 January 2011) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7753 Jackie Baillie: Lollipop Legend—That the Parliament congratulates Bryan Warren on winning Scotland’s Lollipop Person of the Year Award; understands that the children at Jamestown Primary School describe him as the "best lollipop man in the universe"; commends him for donating his prize money to the Vale Of Leven Remembrance Day Association, of which he is the chairman, and further congratulates him for his dedication and commitment to the safety of the children at Jamestown Primary School. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Des McNulty, Ross Finnie, Dr Richard Simpson, Ian McKee, David Whitton, Stewart Maxwell, Hugh Henry, Pauline McNeill, Jamie McGrigor, Sarah Boyack, Mary Mulligan, Marilyn Livingstone, Cathy Peattie, Mr Frank McAveety, Kenneth Gibson, Bill Kidd, Patricia Ferguson, Jim Tolson, Helen Eadie, Gil Paterson, Karen Whitefield, Sandra White, Elaine Murray, Stuart McMillan
